• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result

completed or implemented.

achieved.

If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
• (2) An institution shall have the following
documentation of an admission physical
examination for each resident, unless an earlier
examination is medically indicated:
• (b) For a resident 3 years of age or older,
a physical examination shall have been
completed within 1 year prior to

admission or a new physical examination
shall be completed within 30 calendar
days after admission.
One of three active youth files reviewed did not have the physical examination
completed within 30-days of admission. The Youth was admitted on 2/13/23 and
the physical examination was documented to have occurred on 3/23/23 which is
38 days after admission.
CCI Rule 400.4147 Dental care
• (2) A dental examination within 12 months prior
to admission shall be documented or there shall
be an examination not later than 90 calendar
days following admission.
Two of three active youth files reviewed did not have documentation that the
initial dental examination was completed within 90-days of admission. The two
were late 107 and 136 days respectively.
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (3) The initial treatment plan shall include all of
the following:
• (c) Treatment goals to remedy the
problems of the resident and family, and
time frames for achieving the goals.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have time frames documented
for the treatment goals in the initial treatment plans reviewed.
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (3) The initial treatment plan shall include all of
the following:
• (d) Indicators of goal achievement.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have documentation of
indication of goal achievement in the three initial treatment plans reviewed.

CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (3) The initial treatment plan shall include all of
the following:
• (e) The person responsible for
coordinating and implementing the
resident and family treatment goals.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have documentation of the
person responsible for coordinating and implementing the treatment goals in the
three initial treatment plans reviewed.
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (3) The initial treatment plan shall include all of
the following:
• (f) Staff techniques for achieving the
resident’s treatment goals, including a
specific behavior management plan. The
plan shall be designed to minimize
seclusion and restraint and include a
continuum of responses to problem
behaviors.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have documentation of the staff
techniques for the three initial treatment goals reviewed.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (3) The updated treatment plan shall include all
of the following information:
• (e) For youth 14 years of age and over, a
plan to prepare the youth for functional
independence.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have the youth's signature on
the updated treatment plans reviewed.

CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
• (4) The social service worker shall sign and date
the initial treatment plan.
Two of three active youth files did not have documentation of the social service
worker's signature on two of the updated treatment plans reviewed.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (3) The updated treatment plan shall include all
of the following information:
• (a) Dates, persons contacted, type of
contact, and place of contact.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have the dates, persons
contacted, type of contact and place of contact outlines in the treatment plan. This
involves seven updated treatment plans reviewed.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (3) The updated treatment plan shall include all
of the following information:
• (b) Progress made toward achieving the
goals established in the previous
treatment plan.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have the progress on each
updated treatment plan documented. This involved seven updated treatment
plans reviewed.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (3) The updated treatment plan shall include all
of the following information:
• (c) Changes in the treatment plan,
including new problems and new goals to
remedy the problems. Indicators of goal

achievement and time frames for
achievement shall be specified along with
a specific behavior management plan
designed to minimize seclusion and
restraint and that includes a continuum of
responses to problem behaviors.
Three of three active youth files reviewed did not have documentation of time
frames for goal achievement. This involved seven updated treatment plans.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Discussed with the facility the issues presented with the treatment plans and
what caused this issue. They will add this information into their CAP.
Suggested more training for the staff responsible for the treatment plans and
more oversight from the Chief Administrator.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Discussed the staffing issues and what actions they are taking to hire more
appropriate staff. They are connecting with different services for assistance in
this area.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period involving four rule violations.
2022 Interim inspection violations:
4113 Central Registry Checks: All staff have been clearned and the facilty is now
following the process (changed during the past year) to ensure CRC is obtained as
required.
4114 Tuberculosis Screening: The employee file check list was updated to include
documentation of TB screening is included in the file. Staff were trained on the
process of obtaining documentation prior to offereing employment to an individual.
The facility provided documentation through their quarterly inspections that the
new process was audited internally.

Special Investigation 2023C0000560:
4130 Privacy and Confidentiality: The policy was updated and training provided to
all staff. Staff were required to sign in for training and this information was placed
in the personal file for each staff. The Chief Administrtor reviewed personal files for
compliance.
Special Investigation 2024C0000824SI:
4128 Initial Staff Orientation and Ongoing Staff Training: These steps have just
begun and the facility is in the process of hiring a clinical administrative individual
who will oversee the action of training and documenting the training in the
personal file of each employee. Until this position is hired, the Chief Administrator
will oversee the process and review the personal files monthly. The facility did
provide documentation of this monthly review during their last quarterly inspection.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator documents the two violations found in the interim licensing
inspection and what actions have been taken to resolve these issues. Neither of
these issues were found during this renewal inspection. She also documents the
two violations found during two special investigations 2023C0000560 and
2024C0000824SI. The CAP for 2023C0000560 involved the facility developing a
new “Privacy and Confidentiality” policy that covers the video taping of youth in the
program. The facility provided a copy of this new policy which was approved and
documentation that training has taken place for all staff (new and older). The CAP
for 2024C0000824SI was just implemented but documentation indicates the Chief
Administrator has begun to audit employee files to ensure training is taking place
as outlined in the CAP. The Chief Administrator identified there has been no
unplanned or disrupted removal from the facility during the period under review.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff interviewed reported a positive experience working with the youth and
having received training to help understand trauma and autism. They also reported
a belief that administration is very supportive and helpful in their development.
The youth interviewed reported feeling safe and cared for at the facility. All five-
youth interviewed reported enjoying the facility and having their needs met. They
reported numerous activities that help them develop skills for adult life. Interactions
between staff and youth were observed and appeared positive and supportive of
the youth.

Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a two-story facility licensed for 6 youth with two youth in two bedrooms and
the fifth youth in his own bedroom. The bedrooms are furnished very appropriately,
and the facility is well maintained. All plumbing is in working order and the facility
was well stocked with food and fresh items of food. The menu was posted as was
the emergency phone numbers. The medication and cleaning supplies were
locked according to the rules. The bed check log and emergency drills log were
observed, and all were appropriate. Overall, the facility is in excellent shape and
care.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
